title: Tim Tebow drops by Texas prison to surprise fellow devout Christian inmate who wrote him a letter
text:
It's not every day that a celebrity athlete responds to a jailhouse fan letter by showing up to meet the author in person, but Tim Tebow - one of nation's most famous and outspoken Christian athletes - did just that last week.

After speaking at a pro-life Christian event in Waco, Texas on Thursday, the 32-year-old former NFL star-turned ESPN college football analyst took a detour to the Alfred D. Hughes high security prison unit in Gatesville, Texas.

The 2007 Heisman Trophy winner was honoring the request of an inmate's father who wrote to the Tim Tebow Foundation asking its namesake to pay him and his son a visit.

Tebow's charity worked with local prison ministry group Discipleship Unlimited and prison officials to arrange the meeting.The unnamed dad and his son reportedly had no idea Tebow was coming.

Scroll down for video

Tim Tebow, 32, traveled to the Alfred D. Hughes high security prison unit in Gatesville, Texas on Thursday to honor the written request of an inmate's dad

The Tim Tebow Foundation arranged the surprise visit with local prison ministry group Discipleship Unlimited after receiving a letter from the inmate's father. Tebow lost a push-up competition to one of the inmates at the gathering before telling his followers on Instagram 'I got smoked!'

They and hundreds of other prisoners greeted Tebow with handshakes and hugs before hearing some words of inspiration.

'He was just telling them that he was there because he loves them and they have a purpose and they can fulfill that purpose even where they are,' Disciples Unlimited leader Suzanne McDonald told KWTX.

'He told them God loves them and there is nothing they could have done that would interfere with that love.'

Tebow reportedly spent roughly five hours at the penitentiary. He another inmate even engaged in a push-up competition on stage that Tebow lost.

Tim Tebow celebrates his 80-yard touchdown pass in overtime, giving the Broncos a 29-23 win over the Pittsburgh Steelers in an NFL football wild card playoff game on January 8, 2012

'We had fun, but I got smoked!' Tebow wrote on Instagram.

He also shared several photos and videos of his visit with his followers on IG and Twitter while thanking the prison's warden and staff.

'So encouraged by what God is doing at Alfred Hughes prison and grateful for the time spent with my new brothers in Christ today!' Tebow added. 'Excited to see how they will use their lives for the Kingdom as the grow closer to God and encourage others to live in faith!'
description: It's not every day that a celebrity athlete responds to a jailhouse fan letter by showing up to meet the author in person, but Tim Tebow - one of the most famous Christian athletes - did just that last week.
